DOCNAME: CASE OF MUSTAFA TAŞTAN v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment;Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and taken to ORG on suspicion of carrying a gun without the required licence . It was also established that he was being sought for on suspicion of establishing a profit - making criminal organisation .
CARDINAL . The following day , CARDINAL DATE the applicant was brought before the GPE public prosecutor . The public prosecutor ordered his release after having taken his statements .

CARDINAL . NORP However , on DATE , certain police officers brought the applicant back to ORG . Immediately after that event , his lawyer filed a complaint with the GPE public prosecutor , claiming that the applicant had been forcibly taken by the police officers despite the public prosecutor ’s decision and had been beaten . She indicated that she had been denied entry into the ORG .
CARDINAL . The applicant claimed to have been released DATE .

CARDINAL . Following his release , the applicant went to a private clinic where he was examined by a doctor who noted that there existed several oedemas and bruises on various parts of the applicant ’s body , caused by blows from a hard object . The doctor specified the places of the said oedemas and bruises as the right frontal area of the face , right cheekbone , left shoulder , left forearm , left leg and left gluteal area . He also maintained that there were cuts in the oral cavity caused by dental pressure . The doctor noted the date of the report as CARDINAL DATE but did not write his name .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant filed a complaint against QUANTITY police officers , alleging that they had inflicted ill - treatment on him .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG submitted an information note to the public prosecutor , stating that the applicant had gone to ORG on DATE of his own will and had stayed there for a brief period of TIME . The note indicated that he had not been officially in custody during that period and had been allowed to see his lawyer . Subsequently , on DATE , ORG further informed the public prosecutor that no record of the applicant ’s meeting with his lawyer had been made .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant maintained before the GPE public prosecutor that he had been forced to stay at ORG for DATE following his release by the public prosecutor and had been denied access to his lawyer during that period . He reiterated his allegations of ill - treatment , arguing that CARDINAL police officers had put him in a barrel full of cold water and had beaten him the whole day . He also submitted a medical report from a private clinic , which he had obtained following his release .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon a request from the GPE public prosecutor to that effect , ORG issued a final report , indicating the findings of the initial medical report and concluding that those findings would keep the applicant from routine activities for DATE .

CARDINAL . The QUANTITY police officers accused by the applicant of ill - treatment gave their statements before the GPE public prosecutor on DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively . They maintained , inter alia , that they had not ill - treated the applicant in any way and that the applicant had only stayed at ORG for TIME on DATE the alleged events took place .

CARDINAL . On DATE the police informed the public prosecutor that the owner of the private clinic , who was a medical doctor , had stated that the initial medical report had not been issued in his clinic and that his name had been fraudulently used on it .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , on CARDINAL DATE the GPE public prosecutor issued a decision not to prosecute the CARDINAL police officers as he found that there was no evidence except the applicant ’s allegations to prove that they had committed the alleged acts .
CARDINAL . Criminal proceedings against the applicant for forging an official document
CARDINAL . On DATE , the public prosecutor instigated criminal proceedings against the applicant before ORG of ORG for forging an official document .
CARDINAL . During the proceedings , the owner of the clinic stated before the court that he had actually examined the applicant and drafted the medical report in question .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon a request of the court , an expert submitted a report , concluding that the handwriting in the medical report in question did not show the same characteristics as that of the owner of the clinic .
CARDINAL . Nevertheless , on DATE ORG submitted another expert report to the court , confirming that the handwriting on the medical report belonged to the owner of the clinic .
CARDINAL . Having regard to the latter expert report and the doctor ’s statements , on DATE the court acquitted the applicant of the charge against him .
CARDINAL . Criminal proceedings against the police officers

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE public prosecutor filed an indictment with ORG , this time accusing the QUANTITY police officers of illegal deprivation of liberty and ill - treatment pursuant to LAW no . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant ’s lawyer gave her statements before the court on DATE . She indicated that the applicant had been dragged by certain police officers following his release by the GPE public prosecutor and that she had not witnessed him being beaten at ORG , where he must have stayed for TIME .

CARDINAL . On DATE the owner of the private clinic , where the applicant had obtained the medical report , stated before the court that he had not examined the applicant . At the following hearing on DATE another doctor , GPE , maintained that at the time of the events he had been working at the said clinic . He stated that he was the one who had examined the applicant and drawn up a medical report about his condition .

CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE the CARDINALth Chamber of ORG heard a certain S.Z.A. , the chief officer who had conducted the administrative investigation against the QUANTITY police officers . According to S.Z.A. ’s statements , although there had been CARDINAL conflicting expert reports about the medical report during the proceedings before the CARDINALst Chamber , later on , ORG had conducted another analysis and found out that the handwriting actually corresponded to that of GPE
CARDINAL . The applicant joined the criminal proceedings against the officers as a civil party ( müdahil ) on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court acquitted the police officers of ill - treatment . The court noted that the medical report issued immediately after the impugned events could not be considered valid as GPE , who had admitted to having examined the applicant in the clinic , had not had the work permit to draw up such a report . It maintained moreover that the report issued by ORG , which relied wholly on the initial report , was invalid as well . The court hence concluded that there was insufficient evidence to convict the accused police officers of inflicting ill - treatment on the applicant . It sentenced the officers to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment for illegal deprivation of liberty and suspended that sentence .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the case , finding that it was time - barred pursuant to LAW and ORG of the former LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) and LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Disciplinary proceedings against the police officers

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , following the GPE public prosecutor ’s indictment of the CARDINAL police officers , on DATE the GPE Governorship assigned a chief officer to conduct a disciplinary investigation into the allegations of illegal deprivation of liberty and ill - treatment concerning the officers .

CARDINAL . During the disciplinary proceedings , on DATE ORG submitted a new expert report , this time concluding that the handwriting on the medical report issued in respect of the applicant actually belonged to GPE

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG held that in the absence of any valid evidence , there was no ground to take disciplinary measures against the CARDINAL police officers . ORG further struck the case out as the statutory time - limit for the alleged offences had expired .
CARDINAL . The former LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) made it a criminal offence to deprive an individual unlawfully of his or her liberty ( LAW generally , LAW servants ) .
CARDINAL . The second paragraph of LAW regulated an aggravated sentence for cases where the accused civil servants threatened or inflicted ill - treatment on the individual concerned .
